sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Good morning, Europe. It's Wednesday, the 19th of January.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Let's start by looking at our top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken heads for Ukraine as Moscow ramps up its military presence on the border.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Washington is warning Russia could attack at any point.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The COVID-19 health crisis could end this year, the World Health Organization says, if richer countries do more to ensure vaccine equity across the globe. From Partygate to the pork pie pooch, Boris Johnson's future as UK Prime Minister hangs in the balance as Tory MPs discuss a vote of no confidence.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Tensions between Russia and the US are continuing to escalate over Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: In its latest military move, Moscow sent troops to Belarus for joint military exercises along the latter's southern border with Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: U.S. officials are warning that the situation is on a knife's edge and an attack from Russia could be imminent.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Where things stand right now, President Putin has created this crisis by amassing 100,000 Russian troops along Ukraine's borders. could be imminent. SOT SOT SOT SOT SOT SOT SOT SOT SOT SOT SOT SOT SOT SOT SOT SOT SOT SOT SOT SOT SOT SOT SOT SOT SOT SOT SOT SOT dangerous situation. We're now at a stage where Russia could at any point launch an attack in Ukraine. In search of a diplomatic way out of the growing crisis, U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken is expected to meet with President Vladimir Zelensky and Foreign Minister Dmitry Kuleba in Kiev to reinforce the United States' commitment to Ukraine's sovereignty and territorial integrity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: He is also due to meet with his Russian counterpart Sergei Lavrov in Geneva on Friday to urge Moscow to take immediate steps to de-escalate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: However Russia has made its stance clear it won't negotiate until NATO promises it will not expand into former Soviet nations, something the US and its allies have rejected.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Amid growing tensions, Sweden has boosted its military presence on the island of Gotland in the Baltic Sea. Its military says it's ready to defend their values.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The Omicron variant is not giving any respite to Europe. France recorded almost half a million new daily cases on Tuesday, its highest ever recorded tally since the start of the pandemic. Meanwhile, coronavirus deaths in hospital increased by 288.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In response to the growing number of new infections in Russia, authorities have shortened the period of self-isolation required for people infected with COVID-19 from 14 to 7 days.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In Romania, the number of new cases has doubled in the past 24 hours as the country battles a fifth wave of the pandemic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It is the second least vaccinated state in the European Union with around 40% of the population fully inoculated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Huge inequities in vaccination rates are a cause for concern at the World Health Organization, with experts claiming that the worst of the pandemic could be over this year if it wasn't for these inequalities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We won't end the virus this year. We may never end the virus. These viruses, pandemic viruses, end up becoming part of the ecosystem. What we can end is the public health emergency. With Europe increasingly pushing for vaccination passports, Denmark has introduced a new measure that allows companies to fire employees if they refuse to show a health pass proving they have been vaccinated or have tested negative for COVID-19.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: From partygate to the pork pie plot, Boris Johnson's role as UK Prime Minister is hanging in the balance, as members of his own party appear to withdraw their support over the lockdown party scandal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Some 20 Conservative MPs are reportedly discussing submitting letters of no confidence, but Johnson still insists he didn't do anything wrong.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Nobody told me that what we were doing was, as you say, against the rules, that the event in question was something that we were going to do something that wasn't a work event.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Johnson's former chief adviser Dominic Cummings says the Prime Minister was forewarned and that the online invitation for the gathering instructed people to bring their own booze.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Was your closest adviser and he said he verbally warned you about this? I can't believe that we would have gone ahead with an event that people were saying was against the rules or against what we were asking people to do.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And nobody warned me that it was against the rules.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Discussions over ousting Johnson have been dubbed the pork pie plot due to one of the mps representing the savory foods heartland in reality 54 letters from tory lawmakers are needed to trigger the vote six mps have so far publicly announced that they have submitted letters in france education minister jean-michel Blanquer is under pressure from teachers' unions

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: over revelations he was on holiday on the Spanish island of Ibiza when he announced a strict new COVID-19 testing protocol for students earlier this month.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Euronews reporter David Chazan has the latest from Paris.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: This row is damaging for the French government's image just three months before a presidential election, and it could hardly come at a worse time for the embattled education minister, Jean-Michel Blanquer. Last Thursday, half the schools in France were closed for the day, as teachers went on strike over his failure to consult them about changes in Covid rules before he announced them in the media.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Teachers are planning more local strikes and street protests this Thursday, so his trip to Ibiza is set to stay in the headlines. Opposition parties and some teachers unions are demanding his resignation, and some senior figures in his own party are growing increasingly impatient with him.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: He's not accused of having broken the law, and this is a relatively small affair compared to the Downing Street party scandal raging in London.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Nevertheless, the timing of this row is terrible for President Macron.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The murder of a 23-year-old schoolteacher in Ireland

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: has united voices from around the world to call for an end of violence towards women.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Last Wednesday, Aisling Murphy was brutally murdered while going for a run in the town of Tullamore, County Offaly.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Vigils in memory of Murphy have been held all across Ireland and in major cities around the globe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Ireland's Taoiseach Micheál Martin and Irish President Michael D. Higgins were among the mourners at her funeral on Tuesday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Gardaí investigating the murder say they've arrested a man in his 30s. Our reporter Ken Murray says Irish authorities have promised to do more to stamp out violence against women.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Aisling Murphy was herself a schoolteacher, a very popular woman, very actively involved in music and sport, and the nature of her killing has, if you like, caught the attention of the nation in such a way that such has been the coverage in the last five days that the government has indicated that it plans to set up a unit and dedicate a minister to look at the whole issue of gender violence, in particular men attacking women. They feel that this particular attack has taken things that step too far and there's going to be a concentrated effort in the months and years ahead to create better awareness about gender violence in the hope that what happened here in Tullamore last Wednesday won't happen again.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Such was the outpouring of grief and support for the Murphy family that vigils were held in a number of Irish centres around the world in places like Boston, in Massachusetts, New York, London, Melbourne and Sydney. Places where there are large Irish communities and the entire Irish diaspora has, if you like, unified together to say enough is enough.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Tech giant Microsoft is buying the gaming company Activision Blizzard for 60 billion euros, acquiring blockbuster games like Call of Duty and Candy Crush.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The deal will help Microsoft grow its mobile gaming profile and provide building blocks for the metaverse.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The announcement comes with Activision still in turmoil over allegations of sexual misconduct.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Following the announcement, chairman Satya Nadella said gaming is the most dynamic and exciting category in entertainment across all platforms today.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The CEO added this new era will make gaming safe, inclusive and accessible to all.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The acquisition marks Microsoft's largest incursion into the competitive world of gaming to date.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The all-cash deal will turn the tech giant maker of the Xbox gaming system into one of the world's largest video game companies, and help it compete with tech rivals such as Meta, formerly Facebook, in creating immersive virtual worlds for both work and play.
